Your First Data Pack._comment: Teach file setup (folders will be created in the appropriate lesson). Create pack.mcmeta. Define what a data pack is. Teach /datapack.

Your First Function._comment: Make a .mcfunction file. Teach /say as a dummy command.

Ticks._comment: Explain what a tick is. Demonstrate tick.json and load.json, when they run, how they run.

Block Manipulation._comment: Placing a Single Block, Filling an Area, Cloning or Moving an Area

Selectors._comment: teach all parameters, types, etc, maybe turn each parameter into parts later

Introduction to Teams._comment: Discuss creating teams and team selector

Structure._comment: Note that NBT is used to refer to SNBT because NBT is not a human readable format, compare it to JSON

Types._comment: (byte, short, int, long, float, double) as numbers, strings, compounds, arrays

parts._comment: Add a table explaining what each one does

Modifiers._comment: Adding, Multipying By Current Value, Multiplying by Base Value

Introduction to Tags._comment: Discuss JSON format, tag types, tags in tags, replace bool, required bool, etc. Also explain that entity tags can be used in selectors, item tags in clear, function tags with function command, etc.

Introduction to Execute._comment: Discuss every kind of parameter except for store, including conditions. This lesson should apply most of the previous knowledge. Also discuss execute if block #tag

Storing Data with Execute._comment: execute store in scores, nbt, etc.

Bossbars._comment: relate this to the previous lesson

Gameplay Commands._comment: discuss everything not covered in any other unit here. discuss weather, time, enchant, experience, gamemode, gamerule, playsound, and worldborder commands

Display._comment: Discuss parents and other display settings like background, titles, frame, etc.

Item Counter._comment: execute store result score objective player run clear player item 0

Item Modifiers._comment: demonstrate how it relates to item command

Advanced Item Manipulation._comment: Do more stuff with the item command. Maybe discuss SelectedItem and slots?

Loot Command._comment: Show placing block entities with loot tables

Conditions with Predicates._comment: Discuss all the different criteria, and also alternatives

Loot Table Conditions._comment: Discuss finding entities with NBT in relation to the NBT unit

Predicate Checking._comment: Discuss execute if predicate as well as the predicate selector

I want to do...._comment: if you want to explain anything extra or in detail like raycasting, shootfacing, bedwars, etc, put it here
